page.title: 07Highbrook - Church
page.content: All Saints Highbrook, a handsome Anglican church built 100 years ago by private benefaction, to save villagers the walk to West Hoathly in winter, serves a relatively small but active community. Since 1940 the parish has been combined with West Hoathly, so it does not have a full range of services each Sunday. It has its own Parochial Church council, Church Wardens and distinctive views on worship, guarding its independent entity. It remains an important focus of interest in the hamlet of Highbrook and the church is usually well attended.The churchyard contains memorials to the Clarke family, prominent landowners whose fortune was originally based on the Coal Industry. It also contains one old "leaping board" memorial.
